definitions.definition: controlled by representatives who are elected by the people of a country; connected with this system

examples.text: They are aiming to make the institutions of the EU truly democratic.
Exercise your democratic right to vote.
There have been major changes in the constitution, but the system remains democratic.
They have a fairly democratic form of government.

definitions.definition: based on the principle that all members have an equal right to be involved in running an organization, etc.
based on the principle that all members of society are equal rather than divided by money or social class

examples.text: In 1776 these were considered dangerously democratic principles.

definitions.definition: connected with the Democratic Party in the US

wordOrigin: early 17th cent.: from French démocratique, via medieval Latin from Greek dēmokratikos, from dēmokratia, from dēmos ‘the people’ + -kratia ‘power, rule’.
